message:
Yes, assuming you leave the Task.Run's in place (that is, WaitAll is waiting on a bunch of Task.Run tasks). When running on the thread pool, there is no context to capture, and so ConfigureAwait(false) would be a noop.

This would be a good first step, reducing one-thread-per-request to one-thread-for-all-requests. The next step would be to replace WaitAll with await-WhenAll and remove the Task.Run's completely; this would give you zero-threads-for-all-requests (fully asynchronous).
